channel.title: MTV News
channel.description: Up to the minute news on music and pop culture.

item.title: 'American Idol' Recap: Taylor Has The Advantage After Neck-And-Neck Finale
item.description: The judges were tough on Katharine in what shaped up to be a neck-and-neck night of final performances. Based on Tuesday alone, it's a tough call, but Taylor could take it thanks to a season's worth of consistent performances.

item.title: Game Arrested On Weapons Charges
item.description: The rapper, born Jayceon Taylor, was pulled over for a traffic violation in a Los Angeles suburb on Saturday about 9 p.m., according to a Burbank Police Department spokesperson. While searching his car, police found brass knuckles.

item.title: Lindsay Lohan Copes With Real-Life Tragedy On Set Of Tragic Film
item.description: As Lohan filmed a traumatic scene on the set of "Bobby," a movie that revolves around an assassination, one of the actress' real-life friends was dying. Lohan had to choose between being on the movie set or at her friend's bedside.

item.title: Judge Says Notorious B.I.G.'s Family Misled Court
item.description: The federal judge who granted a mistrial in the Notorious B.I.G. wrongful-death suit and ordered the city of Los Angeles to pay $1.1 million to the rapper's family said Tuesday that she had been deceived about evidence in the case.

item.title: For The Record: Quick News On Ludacris, Kanye West, Pharrell Williams, Rolling Stones, Nicole Richie & More
item.description: Ludacris appeared in a New York court Tuesday as the 2004 suit alleging that he and Kanye West ripped off a song by the group I.O.F. for the "Stand Up" hook comes to trial. Both Ludacris and West are expected to testify this week.

item.title: Alice In Chains Wrap Up String Of U.S. Club Dates In New York
item.description: There were no surprise guests at the show, but the band played a classic set, including "Down in a Hole" and "Them Bones," for the eager crowd. Comes With the Fall singer William DuVall filled in for late frontman Layne Staley.

item.title: Common, Kanye Going For 'Glory' On Raw, Soulful New Songs
item.description: It wasn't enough for Common to just Be — one year after his Grammy-nominated sixth album, he's well on his way to finishing up its sequel, Finding Forever. Com said the new song "The Glory" is a "hard, raw joint."

item.title: Flaming Lips Announce Summer Tour Dates
item.description: The Flaming Lips have announced dates for their summer tour, which begins July 22 in California. The band will be joined by Sonic Youth, Go! Team or Wolfmother at various dates.

item.title: Primus' Les Claypool Skewers Jam Bands In New Mockumentary
item.description: Les Claypool isn't above making jokes at the expense of the kind of jam bands he's played alongside during his career. The Primus leader's new movie "Electric Apricot: Quest for Festeroo" is a mockumentary loaded with hippie humor.

item.title: Students Face School Discipline For 'Inappropriate' MySpace Posts
item.description: A school district suburban Chicago has passed changes to conduct codes that will make students at two high schools accountable for "illegal or inappropriate" material they post to blogs or MySpace pages.

item.title: Jessica Alba, Green Day, Ciara Weigh In On 'Idol' Finale
item.description: Alba has a family party planned for the finale, where she hopes Katharine takes the crown. Billie Joe Armstrong thinks the contest should ditch the singers and let Americans whittle down politicians instead.

item.title: Red Hot Chili Peppers Hold Off Cam'ron, Make It A Billboard Double
item.description: Red Hot Chili Peppers will spend a second week at #1 on Billboard's albums chart with Stadium Arcadium. Sales of the double LP dropped 65 percent, but not enough for Cam'ron's Killa Season to assume the throne.

item.title: Al Gore Gives Reasons To Hope In Fight Against Global Warming
Mariah Carey Plots Mimi's Touring Adventure
item.description: Mariah Carey is taking Mimi on the road for the Adventures of Mimi: The Voice, the Hits, the Tour, her first full-scale road trip since 2003. The adventure kicks off in Miami on August 8 and wraps October 10 in Phoenix.

item.title: U2 Want Everyone To Pay Tribute To 'The Original Rapper'
item.description: U2 are trying to introduce fresh ears to 71-year-old legend Leonard Cohen, a poet/songwriter-turned-Zen monk whose famous fans appear in a new documentary called "Leonard Cohen: I'm Your Man."
